title: 114_hr4289
content: The Tanana Tribal Council is conveyed property in Section 1. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will convey property to the Tanana Tribal Council in Tanana, Alaska for health and social services programs within 180 days of the enactment of the Act. The conveyance will supersede any previous quitclaim deed for the property. The Secretary and the Council will execute a warranty deed for the conveyance of property in Tanana, Alaska, without requiring any consideration or imposing obligations on the Council. The property is described in U.S. Survey No. 5958, Lot 12, containing 11.25 acres. No reversionary interest of the United States is allowed. The Council in Meridian, Alaska, will not be liable for any environmental contamination on the property before its conveyance, including oil, hazardous substances, waste, and pollutants. The Secretary shall have easement access to the conveyed property to address any retained obligations or liabilities related to environmental contamination. Compliance with hazardous substance activity notice and warranty requirements is required under the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980. The conveyance of property to the Bristol Bay Area Health Corporation is authorized. The Secretary is required to convey property to the Bristol Bay Area Health Corporation in Alaska within 180 days for health and social services programs, superseding any previous quitclaim deeds. The property, including land and improvements, is to be conveyed to the Bristol Bay Area Health Corporation in Alaska without any conditions or reversionary interest by the United States. It is located in Dental Annex Subdivision, Dillingham, Alaska. The property in Dillingham, Alaska, containing 1.474 acres, will be conveyed to the Bristol Bay Area Health Corporation without any environmental liability for contamination present before the conveyance date. The Secretary shall be accorded any easement or access to the property conveyed as necessary to satisfy any retained obligation or liability. The Secretary must comply with environmental laws regarding hazardous substances in carrying out this section.
